content.raw:
@caguero and @brian_bingham ,

Due to the last PR for merging Docker images, the code these images will be built from is slightly ahead of 1.0. The only impact this has is that the version of the repository stored inside the image will have the newer docker scripts. Do we think this is worth fixing, either by building from exactly what is marked 1.0 or creating a 1.0.1 tag, or something else?
content.html:
@caguero and @brian_bingham ,

Due to the last PR for merging Docker images, the code these images will be built from is slightly ahead of 1.0. The only impact this has is that the version of the repository stored inside the image will have the newer docker scripts. Do we think this is worth fixing, either by building from exactly what is marked 1.0 or creating a 1.0.1 tag, or something else?
